attributes.action: PM David Cameron to continue his role as prime minister
attributes.background: David Cameron was elected by the public to lead the United Kingdom for the second time. He should continue this as he chose to give the country a referendum he knew the possible outcomes. We should not now depend on someone who wasn't voted in to take the country into the most uncertain future.

rejection.details: The resignation of an individual Minister, including the Prime Minister, is not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole. It is a decision for the individual concerned. The UK Government or Parliament cannot stop a Minister resigning.
